top_card.thesis_one_liner: SELL/TAKE_PROFITS - CROWDED timing with 59/100 opportunity score

latest.title: Investor Webinar on 26 February 2026
latest.content:
6 Feb 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 9463R
McBride PLC
06 February 2026
6 February 2026
McBride plc
("McBride" or "the Group")
Investor Webinar on 26 February 2026
McBride plc,
the leading European manufacturer and supplier of private label and contract manufactured products for the domestic household and professional cleaning/ hygiene markets, will give an investor presentation by webinar following publication of its Interim results for the six months ended 31 December 2025.
The Company will host the online webinar at
11am on Thursday 26th February
,
where Chris Smith (CEO) and Mark Strickland (CFO) will give a presentation followed by a Q&A session.
The webinar is open to all existing and potential shareholders.
Registration for the event is free. Questions can be submitted in advance to
info@equitydevelopment.co.uk
which, in addition to those raised during the presentation, will if possible be addressed by the presenters at the end of the webinar.
To attend the event please register
here
.
A recording will be available shortly after the webinar on
www.equitydevelopment.co.uk
- Ends -
For further information please contact:
McBride plc
Chris Smith, Chief Executive Officer
via TEAM LEWIS
Mark Strickland, Chief Financial Officer
TEAM LEWIS
Hannah Scott
+44 20 7802 2634
Galyna Kulachek
+44 20 7802 2664
Equity Development Ltd
Matt Evans
+44 20 7065 2690
This information is provided by Reach, the non-regulatory press release distribution service of RNS, part of the London Stock Exchange. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact
rns@lseg.com
or visit
www.rns.com
.RNS may use your IP address to confirm compliance with the terms and conditions, to analyse how you engage with the information contained in this communication, and to share such analysis on an anonymised basis with others as part of our commercial services. For further information about how RNS and the London Stock Exchange use the personal data you provide us, please see our
Privacy Policy
.
END

latest.title: Transaction in Own Shares
latest.content:
27 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 4225Q
McBride PLC
27 January 2026
27 January 2026
McBride plc
Transaction in Own Shares
McBride plc (the "
Company
") announces today it has purchased the following number of its ordinary shares of 10 pence each ("
Ordinary Shares
") through Investec Bank plc (the "
Broker
").
Ordinary Shares
Date of purchase:
26th January 2026
Number of ordinary shares purchased:
7,852
Lowest price per share (pence):
145.00
Highest price per share (pence):
145.00
Weighted average price per day (pence):
145.0000
The Company will purchase the above Ordinary Shares through the Broker on the London Stock Exchange (the "
Purchases
") and will subsequently cancel them.
Such Purchases form part of the Company's existing buyback programme and were effected pursuant to the non-discretionary agreement entered into with the Broker, as announced on 1st December 2025.
Following the Purchases and cancellation of these Ordinary Shares, the Company will have 177,035,346 Ordinary Shares in issue (excluding treasury shares), hold 42,041 Ordinary Shares in treasury, and have 594,610,458 non-cumulative redeemable preference shares of 0.1 pence each in the Company (
"B Shares"
) in issue. B Shares carry no rights to attend, speak or vote at Company meetings, except on a resolution relating to the winding up of the Company.
Once the Ordinary Shares are cancelled, the total number of voting rights in the Company will be 177,035,346. This figure may be used by shareholders of the Company as the denominator for the calculations by which they can determine if they are required to notify their interest, or a change to their interest, in the Company pursuant to the Disclosure and Transparency Rules (the "
DTRs
").
The Company confirms that, in accordance with DTR 5.5.1R, following the Purchases the percentage of voting rights attributable to the Ordinary Shares held in treasury is 0.02 per cent.
The tables below contain detailed information about the Purchases.

company_30s.what_they_do: McBride plc designs, manufactures and supplies private‑label household and professional appliances – things like kitchen gadgets, small household devices and contract‑manufactured consumer goods.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The company sits in a large European market for domestic and professional appliances, where brands often outsource production. McBride’s contracts give it steady revenue streams and the ability to scale quickly when demand rises.
company_30s.current_state: McBride has recently finished a strong earnings period, reinstated a dividend, cut debt and launched a share‑buyback programme. The stock is trading near its historic low, with most of the earlier upside already taken.

rns_narrative: McBride is in a classic bottom‑phase story: it’s paying a dividend again, cutting debt, and buying back shares – all signals that the company believes it is undervalued and wants to reward investors.
The investor webinar on 26 February will likely reveal the next step of the buyback and any new contracts, which could spark a bounce.
Recent filings show the board has already bought back a chunk of its own shares, indicating confidence that the price is below intrinsic value.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Maximum pessimism – almost no one is talking about McBride, and the few posts are mostly negative.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bulls remain – the share price has been hammered and there’s no visible support.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bearish chatter focuses on the low price and the fact that the company is still a small cap, but it’s also the reason the stock is cheap.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The market moved from panic to apathy, signalling late‑stage capitulation.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends are flat – no search interest, which means any news could surprise the market.

near_term_catalysts: The 26 February investor webinar could announce the next tranche of the buyback or a new contract win.
A volume spike on the daily chart (e.g., >5 M shares) would confirm that traders are starting to trade the stock again.
A positive earnings update or a new product launch could serve as a catalyst for a rebound.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for daily close above the 0.5p level with volume >10 M shares, and signs of short covering (e.g., a sudden jump in short‑interest metrics).
expect_next.timing_regime: We’re in the late‑stage washout: most of the easy buyers are gone, so a contrarian can now enter with a tight stop.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – the stock is a deep crash bottom with a high probability of a mean‑reversion bounce.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: Green signals historically deliver a 39 % bounce. If the price recovers 50 % from its current level, that’s a 2× return. The buyback and dividend add extra confidence that the company is undervalued.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The worst that can happen is another 10–15 % drop; the 86 % drawdown has already removed most of the weak hands.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 15 % downside vs reward 100 % upside – a 1:7 asymmetry.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter 25 % of the position now, with a stop 10 % below the entry. Add 25 % more on a volume‑confirmed bounce or after the webinar if it looks positive.
playbook.if_watching: Wait for a daily close above 0.5p and a volume spike of >10 M shares before committing. If the webinar delivers a clear buyback extension or new contract, then enter.
playbook.if_passing: Skip if the company shows signs of delisting or bankruptcy – otherwise stay bullish.

ai_insights.bottom_line: McBride is a classic deep‑crash contrarian play: 86 % drawdown, dead trends, and a buyback that signals undervaluation – 1:7 risk/reward if the price bounces.

_selected_rns.title: Redemption of B Shares and Total Voting Rights

panic_analysis.interpretation: 🟢 Normal volatility - not a crash signal
panic_analysis.opportunity_reason: 😐 Normal market conditions - no crash signal

fear_vs_facts.verdict: ✅ Facts align with low fear - Normal risk/reward

technical_score.reason: AI Technical Score 13.0/20 translates to 16/25 points

reasons_to_buy.reason: Historically strong runner - massive upside when it moves
Proven winner - previously hit lock-in target

reasons_to_sell.reason: Stale signal - not for active trading

trader_plan.risk: Stop below recent support / invalidation level
